title: WILSON ACCUSED IN ILLEGAL WORKER FLAP
body:
Challenger Kathleen Brown charged Monday that Gov. Pete Wilson intervened in 1989 with the Immigration and 
Naturalization Service on behalf of a campaign contributor who hired undocumented immigrant workers. Wilson 
aides acknowledged that the governor, then a U.S. senator, did write a letter to the INS the day after federal agents 
raided two San Diego hotels -- the Bahia and the Catamaran -- looking for illegal immigrants. But they argued that 
Wilson's letter did not defend the hotels' hiring practices and had no bearing on the outcome of the case, in which 
owner Anne Evans ultimately was fined $70,000.
